nodes.bodyText: Should we add 2 more test cases with a valid task id + invalid comment id & invalid / wrong taskid + valid comment id?

I added a test for a valid taskId+invalid taskCommentId, good idea :). A test for wrong taskId + valid taskCommentId doesn't make much sense to me, since this combination basically can't exist. A task comment only exists, when a task also exists. How can there be a valid taskCommentId (and therefore a existing taskComment) when the task doesn't exist?
the second parameter should be a pathvariable taskId, right?
Is there a nicer way? This is not really readable :/
please extract the content into a variable for readability :)

Does it matter that this scenario is not 100% correct?
The "true" scenario is that someone else modified the comment and you tried to update an old comment. Not a newer one..
Since we are comparing the modified timestamps as of now this should't matter, right?

Actually the test is doing exactely that. In the test there is an update of a task comment. (which then gets a more recent modified timestamp). Then there is an attempt to update that task comment again with a modified timestamp before the most recent update.
So someone else modified it before the second update attempt which is resulting in an expected concurrency exception.
I did not verify that the snippes actually exist. The build will do that for us :)
